entries: Simple Guard

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

Guard captains are particularly influential guards, being effectively one step higher in their chain of command. One may have authority over anywhere from two to twenty lower-ranking guards. When keeping watch over a large area with a sizeable unit, the captain tends towards a central position from which commands can be issued most effectively. If a captain swears fealty to a kingdom or other large organization, it is likely subservient to knights, generals, or high-ranking nobles.

action.name: Multittack
entries: The captain makes two melee attacks

action.name: Longsword (One-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longsword (Two-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: ShortBow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the captain can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the captain. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the captain is {@condition incapacitated}. (An {@condition incapacitated} creature can't take actions or reactions.)
Guard with Bow

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: ShortBow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6+1}) piercing damage.

Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.
SImple Guard Elite

action.name: Spear (One-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spear (Thrown)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spear (Two-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.
City Guard

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the martial commander can deal an extra 10 (3d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the martial commander that isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The commander makes three melee or two ranged attacks

action.name: Longsword (One-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longsword (Two-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Javelin (Thrown)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the commander can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the commander. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership. die at a time. This effect ends if the commander is incapacitated.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The commander adds +2 AC against a melee attack that would normally hit it. To do so, the commander must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
City Guard

trait.name: Tactical Insight
entries: The city watch captain has advantage on initiative rolls. City watch soldiers under the captain's command take their turns on the same initiative count as the captain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The city watch captain makes two rapier attacks and one dagger attack. The captain can substitute a disarming attack for one rapier attack.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger (Thrown)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

action.name: Disarming Attack
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: the target must make a successful DC 13 Strength saving throw or drop one item it's holding of the city watch captain’s choice. The item lands up to 10 feet from the target, in a spot selected by the captain.

action.name: Orders to Attack (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the city watch captain’s choice that is within 30 feet of it and can hear it makes one melee or ranged weapon attack as a reaction. This person could easily have been on the other side of the law, but he likes the way he looks in the city watch uniform-and the way city residents look at him when he walks down the street leading a patrol. With a long mustache and a jaunty cap, there’s no denying that he cuts a rakishly handsome figure. While a trained investigator, the city watch captain is not afraid to draw his blade to end a threat to his city.
City Guard

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the guard can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack ifthat creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the guard that isn’t incapacitated.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.
